medical_history.chief_complaint: Intermittent right upper quadrant pain, nausea, vomiting, and elevated alkaline phosphatase levels over several months.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms have been ongoing for several months. She has experienced intermittent sharp abdominal pain radiating to the back, nausea, and vomiting, with notable changes such as urine appearing completely brown. Symptoms likely aggravated by her medical history of previous surgeries.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Asthma, migraine headaches, chronic post-surgical pain syndrome, depression, panic attacks, bipolar affective disorder, status post cholecystectomy, status post gastric bypass surgery.
